Describes the Regions that are enabled for your account, or all Regions

Source: R/ec2_operations.R
ec2_describe_regions.Rd

Describes the Regions that are enabled for your account, or all Regions.

For a list of the Regions supported by Amazon EC2, see Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud endpoints and quotas.

For information about enabling and disabling Regions for your account, see Managing Amazon Web Services Regions in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

ec2_describe_regions(Filters, RegionNames, DryRun, AllRegions)

Arguments

Filters

The filters.

  • endpoint - The endpoint of the Region (for example, ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com).

  • opt-in-status - The opt-in status of the Region (opt-in-not-required | opted-in | not-opted-in).

  • region-name - The name of the Region (for example, us-east-1).

RegionNames

The names of the Regions. You can specify any Regions, whether they are enabled and disabled for your account.

DryRun

Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

AllRegions

Indicates whether to display all Regions, including Regions that are disabled for your account.

Value

A list with the following syntax:

list(
  Regions = list(
    list(
      Endpoint = "string",
      RegionName = "string",
      OptInStatus = "string"
    )
  )
)

Request syntax

svc$describe_regions(
  Filters = list(
    list(
      Name = "string",
      Values = list(
        "string"
      )
    )
  ),
  RegionNames = list(
    "string"
  ),
  DryRun = TRUE|FALSE,
  AllRegions = TRUE|FALSE
)

Examples

if (FALSE) {
# This example describes all the regions that are available to you.
svc$describe_regions()
}
